description: All knowledge about PMF from Sajith Pai - frameworks, case studies, interview insights

core_framework.full_form: Product-Market Fit = Product-to-Problem Fit + Motion-to-Market Fit
core_framework.shorthand: PMF = GRUE (Growth with Retention and Unit Economics)

ppf.name: Product-to-Problem Fit
ppf.definition: Validate that your solution is able to address problems for a set of customers
ppf.question: Does the pain that the customer has go away when they use your product?
ppf.nature: Not an on/off switch - it's a continuum of strength of fit

b2c: Retention curve flatlines at 10% at D90
Organic channels constitute majority of leads

ppf.advice: Don't overbuild the product at this stage. Time is money. Break down assumptions into modular components and test hard things first.

mmf.name: Motion-to-Market Fit
mmf.definition: Reliably, affordably acquire lookalikes of PPF customers to build a large business

components.persona: Customer type you wish to serve

mmf.golden_rule: Uncomfortably narrow personas addressed by one hero channel through a sharp message

unit_economics: S&M costs as 1/3rd of contribution margin

seed.proof_needed: Market exists, playbook to achieve it

series_a_plus.goal: Scale to multiple channels or markets
series_a_plus.proof_needed: PMF achieved, rinse and repeat strategy

biggest_pmf_mistake.error: Confusing PPF (product love from a few customers) for PMF
biggest_pmf_mistake.consequence: Pouring on GTM/customer acquisition fuel in advance of true PMF
biggest_pmf_mistake.why_bad: Premature scaling is the key reason for startup failure

pmf_playbook_chapters.title: Understanding PMF
pmf_playbook_chapters.content: Sets context for why PMF matters, defines PMF as PPF + MMF, case studies of success and failure

pmf_playbook_chapters.title: The Pick
pmf_playbook_chapters.content: Importance of picking the right problem, four routes to the pick, evaluation criteria

pmf_x_ray.title: PMF X-Ray Framework
pmf_x_ray.description: Structured way to understand choices and tradeoffs startups took on route to achieving (or not) PMF

congruent_square.title: The Congruent Square
congruent_square.description: Pre-PMF startups need tight alignment between four key mechanisms
congruent_square.insight: Lack of alignment between these four can be damaging to achieving PMF

cm2_importance.title: Why CM2+ Matters
cm2_importance.insight: Getting to CM2+ is a good shorthand for getting to PMF

PrePMF startups are a learning machine, not an earning machine
Before you go big, you need to get it right. This is what PMF is.
The biggest error founders make is confusing PPF for PMF, then pouring on GTM fuel prematurely
Focus on the monkey, not the pedestal! Solve for the hardest thing first!

Believe what they do, not what they tell
PMF can come and go (ask Paytm's Wallet team or the Clubhouse guys)

marketplaces.description: Two-sided PMF - must achieve for both sides
marketplaces.harder_side: Usually the side with more options
marketplaces.pmf_definition: Figuring a repeatable plan for onboarding the harder side
marketplaces.example: Daycare marketplace: parents (easy side) vs daycare centers (hard side)

media_businesses.priority: Focus on user acquisition first, then monetization
